result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert W Jahn in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 16CM46, 16CM51, 16CF191

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
The victim is present but does not wish to make a statement. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF191 Count 2 - NO CONTEST
16CM46 all counts -  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF191 Count 2, 16CM46 all counts.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
The following are dismissed and read-in: 16CF191 Counts 1 & 3, 16CM51 in its entirety. Domestic Abuse assessments do apply in 16CM51 Counts 2 & 3.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
16CF191 Count 2 - 
9 months jail - STAYED -
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
First 6 months in jail, last 90 days can be on GPS electronic monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Serve 46 days jail.  Credit for 46 days served. 
Continue with his alcohol and drug treatment program and comply with all recommendations from his counselors. 
Engage in any other counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by DOC. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions must be from one pharmacy. 
Sign necessary releases so DOC can monitor compliance with conditions. 
Mental health assessment and comply with any recommendations for treatment, if there are any. 
Not to have any violent or abusive contact with his former spouse, Shannon. Contact is strictly for purpose of child placement and co-parenting. 
Not be on premises where she resides or is employed. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit a DNA sample. 

16CM46 Count 1 -
9 months jail - STAYED - concurrent with any other sentence. 
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
First 6 months in jail, last 90 days can be on GPS electronic monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Placed on 24 months concurrent probation: 
Serve 10 days jail.  Credit for 10 days served. 
Comply with all conditions set forth in 16CF191. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

16CM46 Count 2 -
9 months jail - STAYED - concurrent with Count 1 and 16CF191. 
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
First 6 months in jail, last 90 days can be on GPS electronic monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Placed on 24 months concurrent probation: 
Serve 10 days jail.  Credit for 10 days served. 
Comply with all conditions set forth in 16CF191. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharge. 

16CM46 Count 3 -
90 days jail - STAYED - concurrent with Counts 1 & 2 and 16CF191. 
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
Placed on 24 months concurrent probation: 
Serve 10 days jail.  Credit for 10 days served. 
Comply with all conditions set forth in 16CF191. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharge. 

Court advises of post-conviction relief.
